meanings.definition: A bulb-shaped glass enclosure containing a filament that emits light when an electric current passes through it.
meanings.sent1: I turned on the lightbulb in the lamp to brighten the room.
meanings.sent2: The lightbulb in the ceiling fixture needed to be replaced.
meanings.sent3: Why did the lightbulb refuse to shine? It must be feeling lazy.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like a lightbulb, illuminating the entire room.
meanings.sent5: The lightbulb flickered before finally glowing steadily.

meanings.definition: An idea or insight that suddenly comes to mind.
meanings.sent1: The lightbulb of inspiration lit up in his head as he solved the problem.
meanings.sent2: She had a lightbulb moment and knew exactly how to proceed.
meanings.sent3: Why did the lightbulb of creativity take so long to turn on? Maybe it needed a new filament.
meanings.sent4: The lightbulb of realization finally illuminated her thoughts.
meanings.sent5: His lightbulb of genius shone brightly in the darkness of confusion.
